chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Maria Louise Evey #538355 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served.
Consecutive to: 12CF118 and 13CF17

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Defendant is not to associate with any known drug useres or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting or meeting. 
Pay Court obligations. 
NO CONTACT WITH GARY BEEKSMA
NO CONTACT WITH RENO TORGERSON 
NO CONTACT WITH MISTY WHITE
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes: If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

Defendant Maria L Evey in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 13CF17,16cF35 and 12CF118. Joint agreement. Agreement signed OCt 21 by ADA> State complied with Vic rights. 12CF118 vic request know. 16CF35 written notification by vic witness. Vic did say would like imput, but have no heard anything else from him.. DA did a summary of past criminal history. ADA comments sign amount of Rest to be paid. and that a condition be to still pay joint and several with Welty. Count 1 in case 13CF17. Atty comments the basic facts in case.  Atty comments Self defense. Ct comments not unlaw for vic to hold on to Def. Atty comments can vic use deadly use force to get property back.  Def told invest. what happened. Atty comments several things that happened during the event. DEF comments wants to get better. no reason sentence should not be pronounced upon  def. Drugs are a main reason in this citn. Ct comments Def is always remorseful in court room. Ct agrees with Parties these are prison cases.  Ct looks at agreement of parties. Follow Recommendation of the parties as in the Offer.

Defendant Maria Louise Evey in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA comments agreemnts. would like ct to accept plea then adj for sent.  Plea Ct 1 in 16CF35 then the other 2 cts DRI. Atty comments the agreement is the agreement in front of the court. Understands charge and penalties. Pleads NC. Ct 2 and 3 are readin and dismissed.  signed plea questionnaire. No threat or force to plead NC. pres as pres. Wants ct to accept plea of NC. Ct fids pleas are know and vol given. Ct accepts plea and finds G. Convicted of armed robbery, use of force, repeater.  DA would like at least an hour for sent. ALL cases are coming in for sentencing  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

12CF118/ 13CF17/ 16CF35   Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty in court, defendant Maria L Evey not in court, in custody.  RDK appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status - Stip to specific components of DEJ that were not complied with.  (A,C,H,J)  Asks that the court find that DEJ not complied with and enters a judgment.  Atty states stipulates.  2013 was the DEJ.  Ct finds violate terms of TAD DEJ.  Only DEJ on 13CF17.  Find that plea of NC given know/vol factual basis exists/ court accepted plea prev and fnd guilty, it is adjudged now convicted 943.38(2) uttering a forgery as a repeater.     Currently  16CF35 case set for trial - FSTC on 10-17-16.   - Regarding Uttering a Forgery - victim interest - not that RDK can tell no req for VR notification or any other rights in 13CF17.  Seems appropriate to handle all cases together. 2 counts in 13CF17 - 1 count in 12CF118; plus current case.  No harm in waiting for outcome until after what happens in 16CF35 before sentencing on all cases.  All three cases set for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Maria L Evey in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Was sentenced on case 12CF118 and 13CF17. Atty comments worried that they will proceed with the SEHR and deferred agreement when Client might have a strong defense for a different reason. because of the Co-def's. Atty asking for a adj the matter until Wednesday to see if Co-def was interviewed. Before White's trial on November 1. Da comments would like Eveys case tried before Whites. JT 10/31/2016 for case 16CF35 12 person at 9am. STC 10/17/16 1:45pm. Did State complied with Vic rights on Burglary Case. State comments they were notified but not for a specific date. DA comments that would like an oppt.  to go over information again. Da would like motion to enter judgment  heard today or Wednesday. Atty is fine. HEaring is now. State comments deferred entry of judgment pay a few $25 a month community service provide proof not possess /consume mind altering substances. State has not got proof community service or of the $25 TAD fees. Would like Deputy Hultman Appear for testimony. MH 9/7/16 @ 10:30am. Everything adj to Sept 7, 2016 at 10:30am. Forgery Charge first maybe.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
